sen.j: 藤原 俊兼（ふじわら の としかね、生没年未詳）は、鎌倉時代初期の役人・官吏。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Toshikane (dates of birth and death unknown) was a government official in the early Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』での初出は1184年（元暦元年）4月23日条で、下河辺政義が俊兼を通じて訴え出、頼朝の命により、俊兼が常陸国目代に御書を代書している。
sen.e: The first appearance in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) is the article dated April 23, 1184, and Masayoshi SHIMOKOUBE made a request through Toshikane, and Toshikane wrote gosho (writings/letters of superior) for mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor) by order of Yoritomo.

sen.j: 同10月20日条では頼朝御亭東面の廂を問注所とし、三善康信を筆頭に藤原俊兼、平盛時 (鎌倉幕府政所知家事)が諸人訴論対決の事を沙汰することになったとある。
sen.e: In the article dated October 20, at the east side of the gotei (residence) of Yoritomo was used as a monchujo (a court of justice) and MIYOSHI no Yasunobu, FUJIWARA no Toshikane, Moritoki TAIRA (Chikeji (an official working under mandokoro betto, or a director of the admimistrative board) of Mandokoro of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)) judged arguments of people.

sen.j: 源頼朝に呼び出された俊兼は元々華美な者だったがそのときは特に派手で、小袖十余領を着、その袖の妻は重色になっていた。
sen.e: Although Toshikane was originally showy, he was dressed gorgeously when he was called by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, he wore a dozen kosode (a kimono with short sleeves worn as underclothing by the upper classes) with colorful hems of sleeves.

sen.j: 頼朝は俊兼の小袖の妻を切り、千葉常胤や土肥実平の質素さを引き合いに出しながら「お前は才能に富んだ者なのに倹約ということを知らない」「今後は華美を止めよ」説教する。
sen.e: Yoritomo cut the hem of kosode (a kimono with short sleeves worn as underclothing by the upper classes) of Toshikane, and said 'you have versatile talents, but do not know thrift' and 'stop magnigicence from now on', quoting the simplicity and frugality of Tsunetane CHIBA and Sanehira DOI.

sen.j: 1186年（文治2年）3月6日条では源義経の行方について静御前の尋問を行ったことでも有名で、同年8月15日条は、あの有名な西行の登場シーン、流鏑馬の始まりであり、西行の語る流鏑馬の奥義を頼朝は俊兼に書き取らせている。
sen.e: The article dated March 6, 1186, describes that Shizuka Gozen was inquired about whereabouts of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and the article dated August 15 in the same year described the famous scene of appearance of Saigyo, the beginning of yabusame (the art of shooting arrows on horseback), and Yoritomo made Toshikane write the secrets of the art of yabusame told by Saigyo.

It is known that, according to the article dated March 6, 1186, Toshikata inquired Shizuka Gozen about whereabouts of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune, and the article dated August 15 in the same year described the famous scene of appearance of Saigyo, the beginning of yabusame (the art of shooting arrows on horseback), and Yoritomo made Toshikane write the secrets of the art of yabusame told by Saigyo.
sen.cmt: 原文がやや不明瞭ですが、彼が尋問を行ったことが有名という意味が訳出されていないので、It is known that, according to the article dated March 6, 1186, he inquired Shizuka Gozen about whereabouts に変更しました。訳漏れ箇所は「ことでも有名」の部分です。

sen.j: 同じ京の文官である大江広元、三善康信、二階堂行政ららと比べれば行政実務のトップクラスということではなかったが、奉行人、右筆として常に頼朝の側に居た様子が覗える。
sen.e: Compared with civil officers in Kyoto, such as OE no Hiromoto, MIYOSHI no Yasunobu, and Yukimasa NIKAIDO, he was not a top class official of administrative affairs, but always served Yoritomo as bugyonin and yuhitsu (amanuensis).
